main event: One bluish-white to dull orange tear-shaped object was observed dropping vertically and disappearing by burning out, lasting one to three seconds.
interesting points: The object had a slight trail and resembled a Roman Candle or flare., Observers classified the sighting as astronomical, likely a meteor., The object's colors varied from bluish-white to dull orange., The sighting occurred in Lubbock, Texas., Multiple reports in the area described similar appearances.
sighted object: bluish-white to dull orange tear-shaped object
witness description: Pilots and air operations specialists from Reese Air Force Base
